headline.print_headline: Virginia Governor Will Veto Bid to Block Medicaid Expansion
headline.main: Virginia Governor Will Veto Bid to Block Medicaid Expansion

docs.snippet: Virginia Governor Terry McAuliffe said Friday he will veto a Medicaid amendment to the state budget advanced by a Republican-dominated legislature that could prevent him from expanding access to the program through executive action....
docs.lead_paragraph: Virginia Governor Terry McAuliffe said Friday he will veto a Medicaid amendment to the state budget advanced by a Republican-dominated legislature that could prevent him from expanding access to the program through executive action.

headline.print_headline: Louisiana's Edwards, After Eight Years in Prison, Leads Poll in House Bid
headline.main: Louisiana's Edwards, After Eight Years in Prison, Leads Poll in House Bid

docs.snippet: Former Louisiana Governor Edwin Edwards, who served eight years in prison for racketeering, leads a crowded field for a November open primary in his bid for a U.S. House of Representatives seat but trails head-to-head against two rivals he could f...
docs.lead_paragraph: Former Louisiana Governor Edwin Edwards, who served eight years in prison for racketeering, leads a crowded field for a November open primary in his bid for a U.S. House of Representatives seat but trails head-to-head against two rivals he could face in a runoff, according to a new poll.

headline.print_headline: 140K Expected Each Day of Electric Daisy Carnival
headline.main: 140K Expected Each Day of Electric Daisy Carnival

docs.snippet: More than 140,000 people, many decked out in bikinis, daisy crowns and signature fuzzy boots, are expected to flood into the Las Vegas Motor Speedway each night for the weekend-long Electric Daisy Carnival....
docs.lead_paragraph: More than 140,000 people, many decked out in bikinis, daisy crowns and signature fuzzy boots, are expected to flood into the Las Vegas Motor Speedway each night for the weekend-long Electric Daisy Carnival.

headline.print_headline: Hiker,' Guru of Trails' Missing on Mount Rainier
headline.main: Hiker,' Guru of Trails' Missing on Mount Rainier

docs.snippet: Crews searched Mount Rainier National Park on Friday for a prominent hiker and outdoors writer who was reported missing late Wednesday while she researched a story....
docs.lead_paragraph: Crews searched Mount Rainier National Park on Friday for a prominent hiker and outdoors writer who was reported missing late Wednesday while she researched a story.

headline.print_headline: Ex-Syrian Players Form Opposition Team in Exile
headline.main: Ex-Syrian Players Form Opposition Team in Exile

docs.snippet: A group of Syrian refugees, all former professional soccer players and members of the national youth team in the war-wrecked country, came together in neighboring Lebanon over the past year to execute an ambitious task: Form an opposition team in ...
docs.lead_paragraph: A group of Syrian refugees, all former professional soccer players and members of the national youth team in the war-wrecked country, came together in neighboring Lebanon over the past year to execute an ambitious task: Form an opposition team in exile that would become Syria's national team after the fall of President Bashar Assad's government.

headline.print_headline: Va. Governor Vows to Expand Medicaid on His Own
headline.main: Va. Governor Vows to Expand Medicaid on His Own

docs.snippet: Democratic Gov. Terry McAuliffe vowed Friday to bypass the General Assembly and expand Medicaid eligibility for about 400,000 low-income residents on his own, a move Republican lawmakers immediately promised to fight....
docs.lead_paragraph: Democratic Gov. Terry McAuliffe vowed Friday to bypass the General Assembly and expand Medicaid eligibility for about 400,000 low-income residents on his own, a move Republican lawmakers immediately promised to fight.

headline.print_headline: Russia Opens New Criminal Case Involving Putin Critic Navalny
headline.main: Russia Opens New Criminal Case Involving Putin Critic Navalny

docs.snippet: Russian investigators opened a criminal case into the theft of a picture found in the home of a prominent critic of President Vladimir Putin on Friday, in what his lawyer described as part of a Kremlin campaign against him....
docs.lead_paragraph: Russian investigators opened a criminal case into the theft of a picture found in the home of a prominent critic of President Vladimir Putin on Friday, in what his lawyer described as part of a Kremlin campaign against him.

headline.print_headline: Siemens Says Respects France's Decision on Alstom
headline.main: Siemens Says Respects France's Decision on Alstom

docs.snippet: Siemens on Friday conceded in its battle to take over part of France's Alstom, after France rejected its offer with Mitsubishi Heavy Industries in favor of a rival bid from General Electric....
docs.lead_paragraph: Siemens on Friday conceded in its battle to take over part of France's Alstom, after France rejected its offer with Mitsubishi Heavy Industries in favor of a rival bid from General Electric.

headline.print_headline: Gold, Silver Rise for Third Straight Day
headline.main: Gold, Silver Rise for Third Straight Day

docs.snippet: Gold and silver prices rose for a third straight day, following the Federal Reserve's decision to keep interest rates low for the immediate future....
docs.lead_paragraph: Gold and silver prices rose for a third straight day, following the Federal Reserve's decision to keep interest rates low for the immediate future.
